item.title: Report X-2025050205
item.description:
Report X-2025050205

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE TOOK HAZMAT OFF IRRG CART AND PACKAGES WAS LEAKER AND GOT ON HIS FORARM. FULLTIME SUPERVISOR AND SAFETY WAS CONTACTED AND EMPLOYEE RISED OFF HIS ARM WITH COLD WATER, NO MEDICAL ATTENTION NEEDED. RESPONDER ARRIVED TO SPILL AND FOLLOWED DMP SPILL PROCESS. FOUND THE LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE SIDE OF IRREG BELT AND CONTAINED HAZMAT AND THEN TOOK BACK TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.description:
Report X-2025050011

  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER GOT A CALL TO METRO 2 THAT THERE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE TO METRO 2 AND DISCOVERED A FLAMMABLE LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025050007
item.description:
Report E-2025050007

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1719 had a crack and released approximately one (1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers remediated the dock floor, then retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to perform a tote transfer. The crew transferred the tote and broke down the damaged tote for containerization in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
